{"step_by_step_thinking": "Histamine is present on the surface of mast cells, as mentioned in Document [15]. Mast cells are part of the body's innate immune system and release histamine during allergic reactions. This histamine binding to histamine receptors triggers allergy symptoms such as itching, increased vascular permeability, and smooth muscle contraction. Therefore, the answer is B. Mast cells.", "answer_choice": "B"}
